alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Crawford; Houston; Peach (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 8:28PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron affecting Peach, Bibb, Houston and Crawford Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodland areas upstream and downstream from the gage on Houston Road. Larger portions of creek access roads will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 04/08/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
